description: A man, 65, has been charged for allegedly filming a young girl's private parts using his mobile phone camera during Anzac Day commemorations in Sydney's Hyde Park.
title: NSW girl 'filmed' after Anzac Day march Sydney Hyde Park
title_page: NSW girl 'filmed' after Anzac Day march Sydney Hyde Park | Daily Mail Online
text:
A man, 65, has been charged for allegedly filming a young girl's private parts using his mobile phone camera during Anzac Day commemorations.
A woman became suspicious of the man and alerted patrolling police officers after at commemorations in Sydney's Hyde Park on Tuesday afternoon.
Police observed the man allegedly using his mobile phone camera to film a young girl.
A man, 65, has been charged for allegedly filming a young girl's private parts using his mobile phone camera during Anzac Day commemorations (stock image)
The Anzac Day commemoration in Sydney on Tuesday is pictured
The man was arrested and taken to Day Street Police Station.
He was charged with aggravated filming a person's private parts.
The 65-year-old man was refused bail to appear in Central Local Court on Wednesday.
People stand near the Cenotaph during the annual Anzac Day dawn service at Martin Place in Sydney
People gather at the Cenotaph to lay wreaths on Anzac Day in Sydney
